meanings.definition: A tough, persistent shrub with pink flowers.
meanings.sent1: The hardhack in the garden bloomed beautifully this spring.
meanings.sent2: I planted a hardhack in my backyard for its lovely pink flowers.
meanings.sent3: The hardhack in the yard seems to be showing off its pink blooms.
meanings.sent4: The hardhack stood strong against the wind, its pink flowers a symbol of resilience.
meanings.sent5: The hardhack's pink flowers added a touch of beauty to the otherwise plain garden.

meanings.sent1: I had to hardhack all day to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: She decided to hardhack through the night to complete her assignment.
meanings.sent3: He always seems to hardhack when it comes to cleaning his room.
meanings.sent4: She hardhacked her way through the dense forest to reach the hidden waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The team hardhacked together to meet the deadline for the presentation.

meanings.sent1: The hardhack lock kept the door secure.
meanings.sent2: The hardhack wall stood strong against the storm.
meanings.sent3: The hardhack safe was impossible to crack.
meanings.sent4: Her hardhack determination made her unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The hardhack shield protected the knight in battle.
